Title: AN ACT REPEALING ACT NUMBERED FORTY-FIVE, ENTITLED "AN ACT IMPOSING A CUSTOMS TAX UPON EXPORTS OF MEXICAN MONEY.
Data:
[ Act No. 213, August 31, 1901 ]
AN ACT REPEALING ACT NUMBERED FORTY-FIVE, ENTITLED "AN ACT IMPOSING A CUSTOMS TAX UPON EXPORTS OF MEXICAN MONEY.
By authority of the President of the United States, be it enacted by the United States Philippine Commission, that:
Section 1. Act Numbered Forty-five, entitled "An Act imposing a customs tax upon exports of Mexican money," enacted November twelfth, nineteen hundred, is hereby repealed.
Section 2. The public good requiring the speedy enactment of this bill, the passage of the same is hereby expedited in accordance with section two of "An Act prescribing the order of procedure by the Commission in the enactment of laws," passed September twenty-sixth, nineteen hundred.
Section 3. This Act shall take effect on its passage.1a—àphi1
Enacted, August 31, 1901.
